intro: Petraeovitex ternata var. glabrior, commonly known as the smooth petraeovitex, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its smooth, glabrous stem and leaves distinguish it from other varieties of the species. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
